docs.title: 🚀 DocScanner
docs.text: Welcome to the DocScanner presentation site. Instead of a traditional slide deck, this site gives you a live, always-available overview of our app.

docs.title: 🎯 What is DocScanner?
docs.text:
DocScanner is a lightweight tool designed to help our team:

  • Automate routine tasks
  • Improve documentation quality
  • Save time in reviews and collaboration

👉 Use the navigation menu to explore Features, Usage Guide, and FAQ.

docs.title: Q1: Who can use DocScanner?
docs.text: Anyone in our team who works with documentation (writers, developers, testers).

docs.title: Q2: Do I need to install anything?
docs.text: No. The app runs on the browser. Just upload your file.

docs.title: Q3: Can I use it with GitLab repos?
docs.text: Yes. You can select files directly from GitLab instead of uploading manually.

docs.title: Q4: What file formats are supported?
Q5: Will this replace manual reviews?
docs.text: Not entirely. The app speeds up checks, but human review is still important for context.

docs.title: ✨ Features
docs.text: Here’s what makes DocScanner valuable to our team:

docs.title: 🔍 Intelligent Analysis
docs.text:
• Automatically scans documents for style, clarity, and readability issues.
  • Provides suggestions based on our style guide.

docs.title: ⚡ Fast & Lightweight
docs.text:
• Works on multiple file types (DOCX, PDF, HTML, TXT).
  • Instant feedback, no external dependencies.

docs.title: 📊 Reports & Insights
docs.text:
• Generates a structured feedback report.
  • Highlights problem areas with suggestions.

docs.title: 🔗 Integration Ready
docs.text:
• Works with GitLab repositories.
  • Can be integrated into CI/CD pipelines for automated checks.

docs.title: 🛠 Usage Guide
docs.text: Follow these steps to get started with DocScanner:

docs.title: 1. Access the App
docs.text:
• Open the application from your browser at: http://localhost:5000 (or the deployed link).
  • You will see the homepage with an Upload Document option.

docs.title: 2. Upload a Document
docs.text:
• Supported formats: DOCX, PDF, HTML, TXT, ZIP.
  • Drag & drop your file or select it manually.

docs.title: 3. Review Feedback
docs.text:
• The app displays the content in a clean format.
  • Issues are highlighted sentence by sentence.
  • Suggestions are shown in the Feedback panel.

docs.title: 4. Generate Reports
docs.text:
• Download the analysis report for sharing or future reference.
  • Use it to make documentation improvements quickly.

✅ That’s it! You now have actionable feedback in minutes.
